intro: Hesperocnide tenella, commonly known as the slender false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It has opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Hesperocnide tenella is typically found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
